Description: A national mortgage servicing company agreed to pay $63 million to resolve Federal Trade Commission and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau charges that it harmed homeowners with illegal loan servicing and debt collection practices.

Walter Investment Management Corp. agreed to pay $29.63 million to resolve allegations that through its subsidiaries -- Reverse Mortgage Solution Inc., REO Management Solutions LLC and RMS Asset Management Solutions LLC -- it violated the False Claims Act in connection with participation in the Department of Housing and Urban Development's Home Equity Conversion Mortgages program, which insures reverse mortgage loans.
